A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products, like dishwashing liquid, fabric conditioner, detergent powder, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the necessary materials for her tailoring business. She also has a direct selling business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Lilian dreams for her business to continuously grow. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Amelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Amelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Vincenta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for six years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Vicenta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ablah

texts.en:
Ablah is a 38-year-old married woman from Rafah. She is the mother of three sons & three daughters.  Her husband works as an employee in the public
sector, and also as a taxi driver to cover the family needs and live a decent life.

Ablah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture is of him next to his taxi.

Ablah would like to help her husband in his taxi business so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ablah's husband pay the costs of maintaining the taxi. This will increase the taxi capacity, and earn more money.

loans.use: to pay the costs of maintaining the taxi.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 57 years old and has five children. She is married, and has one child who is in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for 16 years, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, a 37-year-old widow blessed with two children aged 13 and 7 years old, is a tailor in Bomet. In business for seven years, she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Rosemary learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign conducted in the town, and has requested her first loan of KES. 10,000 to purchase fabrics for dressmaking. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children. Rosemary's dreams are to improve her living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Mayra Fabiola

texts.en:
My name is Mayra. I am 23 years old and live with my parents in Iztapalapa, Mexico. I started my gift shop when I was 17 years old with a Mx$5000 investment outside my parents home. Through hard work, I have been able to grow my business and now I sell both retail and wholesale.

I will use the loan to buy more merchandise and increase my sales. I try to provide my clients with good quality products at reasonable prices.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Irene Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is Irene. I am 25 years old and live with my partner in my parents house.

I started working with my grandmother 10 years ago, we used to sell candies and stationary outside an elementary school. 3 years ago, I started my own business selling roasted chicken in a rented local at the Solidaridad Market.

My biggest accomplishment is sending my daughter to school and having some financial stability. 

I am calling the project Rostisería Poi-Pio and believe in providing my clients with great flavor at cheap prices. I will use the loan to buy a larger oven, that way I will be able to attend more clients and grow my business.

loans.use: buy a larger oven for her roasting chicken business.

loans.name: Harusi

texts.en:
Harusi, a 28-year-old married mother of three children, has been operating a salon in Malindi for the last three years. She earns a monthly profit of KES.12,090.

Introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, Harusi is applying for her second loan of 50,000 KES to add to her inventory of hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes needed for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her enterprise and open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional beauty products for her salon business.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: Las rosas son un grupo solidario, integrado por 6  mujeres trabajadoras, que tienen 7 ciclos con su crédito. La Señora Ma Elvira de 40 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva; hace 3 años inició su negocio de venta en mercados rodantes, con el fin de darles una carrera a sus hijos. Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos 2 adolescentes de 17 y 18 años y un bebé de 4 meses. Su meta es tener un negocio establecido de comidas. Las compañeras de Ma Elvira piensan que ella es una mujer muy responsable, limpia y alegre.
texts.en:
Las Rosas is a solidarity group made up of six hardworking members who have had seven loan cycles.

María Elvira, 40, makes a living selling used and new clothing.  She started her sales business in traveling markets three years ago with the goal of giving her children an education.  She's married and has three children, two teenagers, ages 17 and 18, and a four-month-old baby.

Her goal is to set up a food business.

María Elvira's colleagues think she's a very responsible, fair, and happy woman.

loans.use: to stock new clothing

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 65 years old, married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Narcisa has a food production business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Narcisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
This is Juanito, 58, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Vida, a vendor, and is a father to their children. Together with his wife, Juanito manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. 
 
Juanito operates an umbrella and shoe repair service. His regular customers are his neighbors and the people in the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 4000 (Philippine pesos) in sales every week. 

To help him continue operation of his business, Juanito is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy the materials needed in making umbrellas and shoes. 

Juanito dreams to expand his business and hopes to improve his family's living. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the materials needed in repairing umbrellas and shoes.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: El Sr. Napoleón tiene 51 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 22, 15 y 13 años, el  Sr. Napoleón es viudo ya que su esposa falleció, cuenta que  fue un golpe para el, pero por sus hijos salió adelante,   el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Cañada Stronger,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el  Sr. Napoleón va a utilizar  este préstamo en la  compra de semillas para  la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el  Sr. Napoleón enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la su calidad de vida el  Sr. Napoleón es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 51 years old and a widower.  He has three children who are 22, 15 and 13 years old.  He says that his wife's death was a blow for him but that he continued to strive to get ahead in life for the sake of his children.  Napoleón's business is farming.  He sows a variety of vegetables, such as potatoes, cassava and corn, on his plot of land which is located in Cañada Stronger community.

This loan is Napoleón's first with the institution.  He will use it to buy potato seeds and to prepare his soil.  He is requesting this loan so that he will have the resources he needs to sow his crops and survive.  Napoleón faces challenges in his business such as problems with the weather which sometimes ruin his crops.  He will use the profits he makes to improve his quality of life.  Napoleón is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: to sow potatoes

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, egg, cooking oil and seasonings. In the future, Celia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rocio Maria

texts.es:
Rocio es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeña hija y sus padres, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que Rocio es padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Rocio no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Rocio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y bebidas, ella trabaja ocupando un pequeño espacio en su hogar y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Rocio se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rocio se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una congeladora, la cual le servirá de mucho para mantener en mejor estado las bebidas que vende, así como sus alimentos, de esta manera Rocio podrá vender bebidas heladas y tendrá más clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the town of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her young daughter and her parents, whom she loves. Her daughter is her main purpose in life. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, and she dedicates all her effort to providing for her little one because Rocio is both mother and father to her. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because she had to start working when she was very young, Rocio wasn't able to study nursing, but she would have liked doing so. In her spare time she likes to watch television and she occasionally makes a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

Thanks to her mother's support and her own perseverance and dedication, Rocio works selling sweets and drinks. Her small business is set up in a small space in her home and she can work approximately twelve hours. Rocio feels comfortable working and believes the reason why business is going well for her is because of her good prices and the kind service she offers her customers. 

Rocio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because the help they offer will allow her to purchase a freezer, which will be of great help for her to keep the drinks she sells in better condition, as well as the food products. This way Rocio will be able to sell ice cold drinks and will have more customers, so she will keep working and doing her best to achieve her dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously received a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy items to sell to her customers. This loan was a big help in paying for her personal, household and business expenditures. Now she is requesting a new loan, for 50,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items she displays, the higher her profits will be. She will use the additional income she earns to support her family. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and open another store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beinvinida

texts.en: Beinvinida is 61 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living by running a farm where she grows vegetables. She has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this line of work for 35 years and has borrowed and repaid 19 prior loans. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business so that she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida has taken out and repaid a prior loan which helped her business a lot, and is requesting a new loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 13 years and works hard to provide income for her family. She will use this new loan, for 25,000 PHP, to increase her profits and allow her to better care for her family. Loida dreams that her business will continue to expand and meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
A $600 loan is requested by Celeste to improve her business. She is a fishermen and sells fish where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fishing nets, ropes, and buoys. She has been involved in business activities since 2012. She feels very comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Celeste independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, ropes, and buoys

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Delia successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

NWTF is re-listing Delia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 36 years old and sells snacks to primary school pupils at break time. She is a married mother of four school-going children. She has been in this business for the last eight years and she is doing well.

This marks her second time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase a small handcart and stock of sweets, biscuits and roasted groundnuts. 


She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan as well as purchase more assorted stock. She hopes to expand her business in future and live a happy life  in future.

loans.use: to purchase a small handcart and stock of sweets, biscuits and roasted groundnuts

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is 39 years old, married, and a father of five children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

Renson was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000, to buy additional dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from and so on for his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. Renson's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase milk cans, water cans and medicine for his dairy cattle

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old, married, with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marilou has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy computer supplies.

Marilou has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy additional units for her Internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores. She works managing a jeepney transportation service. Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines.  They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating.  Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.  They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

Dolores previously received a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain her jeepney. The earnings from her loan were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Dolores is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney. She will use the profits from her loan to help sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Dolores dreams of having another jeepney. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Fellowship groups are composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and married with four children. For the past five years, she has run a tailoring business in Nairobi. Her business has been profitable and she has received previous loans through KADET LTD.

Grace is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her loan will enable her to meet her customer demand as well as generate more income. Grace will use the profits from her loan to educate her children. In future, she hopes to expand and open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years, she has been a farmer who grows vegetables in the Philippines. Rosalinda has received three previous loans through NWTF to sustain her business. 

Rosalinda is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 46 years old and married with three children who are all in school. For the past 18 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Thelma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Adriana Celeste

texts.en:
My name is Adriana, I am 22 years old and live in Iztapalapa with my husband and a 4 year old son. We live in a house with other relatives.

I started working five years ago selling shoes and clothes through a catalog. But three years ago, I decided to start a food stall in which I sell different types of tacos such as: suadero, longaniza, tripa, maciza, cabeza (beef brisket, spanish sausage, tripe, pork shoulder and pork head).  Sales are growing because people like the flavor of my tacos and because I have my stall in a good location outside a large social housing project. 

I will use the money, to buy some tables,chairs and benches that way I will be able to provide better service to more clients.

My biggest accomplishment has been starting my business and growing the sales.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and benches to expand my food stall.

loans.name: Rute

texts.en:
Rute runs a fishing business that helps generate income for her family. She began her business in 2010 with her own working capital of 200 USD. Rute is a hardworking woman.

Rute is requesting a 600 USD loan to buy equipment such as fishing nets, ropes, buoys, and a refrigerator. In the future, she hopes to run a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, ropes, buoys, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. For the past three years, she has run a motorcycle transport business. She received a previous loan that was a big help in her business and allowed her to buy spare parts and accessories for her tricycle. Marites also used her loan to help educate her children and provide for her family’s household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their family’s everyday needs.

Marites is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle. The profits from her loan will definitely help her to sustain family’s daily needs provide for her children's education. Marites looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, she dreams of having more tricycles and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Marites meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is from Goris town where he lives with his parents and brother. His parents are retired with pensions and his brother works as a policeman. Artashes wants to find a job and help his family, but he couldn't because he has no working experience. He studies at Goris State University and now is in his fourth year. His family's income is barely enough to cover their basic needs and it is very difficult to save money for Artashes's education.

Artashes is requesting a loan through SEF International to pay for his university tuition. His loan is very important for the whole family and especially for Artashes, who hopes to be able to complete his education. He works hard and dreams of becoming a good specialist and finding a job with enough salary to become financially independent.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Tini

texts.en: Tini is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish canes, oil, sugar, and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish canes, oil, sugar, and biscuits

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 37 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Flora was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour

loans.name: Ines Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Inés  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cosméticos y  productos de belleza ella entrega a distintos lugares oficinas y domicilios donde le hacen pedidos,  este préstamo es su cuarta  secuencia dentro de la institución, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo en la compra perfumes y camisas y en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas por mayor, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Inés continues with the same business selling cosmetics and beauty products. She delivers them to various places such as offices and homes where orders are placed. This is her fourth loan with the institution. She reports that the previous loan worked out very well for her and she used it to buy perfumes and shirts. On this occasion she requests the loan in order to purchase wholesale costume jewelry. The reason why she requests the loan is to increase her working capital and therefore improve her family's living conditions. She feels happy and thankful towards the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y  venta de pan conversando con ella nos conto  que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos ya que ahora incremento su producción, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, manteca y demás insumos por mayor para la elaboración de pan ya que en este último tiempo incremento su clientela.
texts.en: Maria continues with the same business baking and selling bread. She reports that the previous loan worked out very well for her, since she used it to buy supplies because her production has recently increased. On this occasion she requests the loan in order to purchase flour, butter and other wholesale supplies for baking bread, because her clientele has been growing of late.

loans.use: to purchase flour and yeast for baking bread.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is from Vanadzor town, where he lives with his parents and brother. Gurgen studies at Armenian-Russian International University after Mkhitar Gosh, where he specializes in the legal department.

As the only breadwinner of the family, Gurgen's father (in the photo), works hard to sustain the family's living and ensure a better life for them. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for him to save money for Gurgen's education. So Gurgen has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition.
The loan is very important for him to continue his education and make his dream come true. Gurgen dreams of becoming a lawyer after graduation and having a job with enough salary to be financially independent.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old salon and massage parlor proprietor in Bamburi, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of two whose spouse provides additional income.  She has been in this business for the last year and has done great.

This marks her second time borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will use the loan to expand her salon, and purchase towels and massage creams. 

She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and give back to the business. She hopes to be famous in town and have several clients in the future.

loans.use: to expand her salon and purchase towels and massage creams

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 30 years now. She sells home cooked snack foods and bakes bread and sells it to the people in her area.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make bread like flour, sugar, margarine, and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread like flour, sugar, margarine, and cooking oil

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a 60-year-old widowed mother of 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines.

Vivencia requested a PHP13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Vivencia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vivencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Parkire

texts.en:
Parkire is a 28-year-old, single gentleman. For a living he has been a farmer in the town of Narok for the past five years. 

His monthly income is KES35,000, and with a fourth loan of KES45,000 from KADET, he plans to purchase livestock and prepare his garden for crop growing. He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock and prepare his garden.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Benson owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community. He has been in this business for over 3 years, and earns PHP1,500 every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of PHP4,000 to purchase spare parts. 

In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house, and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Nelly Narcisa

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 6 de ellos son  mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años de edad,  uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Nelly trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus hijos, ellos se dedican a la venta de leche y quesos, su hijo se desplaza por los campos en un carro que ellos tienen, allí compran la leche todas las mañanas a los ganaderos para luego llevarla hasta su casa en la cual una parte elaboran el delicioso queso y la otra parte la venden por localidades vecinas junto con el queso que el día anterior ella a fabricado, trabajan todos los días en las mañanas y llevan más de 10 años realizando esta labor.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del grupo y le  gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante y que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of the Merorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as Tierras Amarillas of the Rocafuerte settlement. This area is known for its agriculture because a large number of its residents raise short cycle crops.

Nelly lives here.  She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children; six of whom are adults.  The youngest are 16 and 14.  One of the older ones studies at university and the younger ones attend high school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Nelly works in partnership with one of her sons and they sell milk and cheeses.  Her son travels the fields by car and buys the milk from the farmers every morning.  He then takes it home and they use part of it to make the delicious cheese.  They sell the rest in the neighboring areas, along with the cheese they made the previous day.  They work every morning and have been doing this for 10 years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy milk.  She’s been with the communal bank since the beginning, serves as the treasurer and enjoys it because her fellow members are very united and responsible.  Her dream is to continue ahead and for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Adriana Querida

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y la menor estudia en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Adriana para salir adelante y ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido que no gana mucho en el campo, hace tiempo atrás y con la ayuda de su esposo construyeron una cabaña donde todas las tardes venden corviches, empanadas, totillas de yuca y de maíz, además de aguas, colas y jugos. Los fines de semana también prepara platos típicos como los  deliciosos secos y caldo de gallina criolla, caldo de mondongo con verduras, platos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar maíz, yuca, maní, gallinas y otros víveres para preparar los deliciosos platos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le  gusta por la ayudan que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional, razón por la cual lucha día a día en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The members of the Merorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as Tierras Amarillas of the Rocafuerte settlement. This area is known for its agriculture because a large number of its residents raise short cycle crops.

Adriana is 57 years old, married and has frour children; all adults now.  Two of them still live at home and the youngest attends university.  Her husband is a farmer.

Adriana, in order to get ahead and earn some money on her own she she could her husband who doesn’t earn much in the fields, started a business where she sells corviches, empanadas, yucca and corn tortillas, in the evenings, drinks, colas, and juices from a cabana they built.  She also prepares typical dishes, such as chicken soups, criolla, and tripe soup with vegetables, on the weekends.  Her customers seek these dishes.

She will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn, yucca, peanuts, chicken, and other foods to prepare her delicious dishes.  She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she like it because of the loans.  Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional and this is why she works so hard every day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, whose previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy the ingredients needed in making macapuno. It also helped in their household expenditures.

Evelyn now sells fruits and vegetables and is requesting a new loan for 15,000 PHP to buy various fruits and vegetables that are needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs, and she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora  María, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 15 y 13 años de edad, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella los dos menores  estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de pescado, su esposo se desplaza por toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos en un triciclo de su propiedad, los mismos que en la madrugada compra en la ciudad de Manta a pescadores que llegan hasta las playas de esa ciudad, él tiene más de 12 años dedicado a esta actividad y es así como el lucha para que a su familia no les falte  nada.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta diaria. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan estos créditos para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su esposo realice sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The members of the José Cesario Reyes communal bank meet every two weeks in the Montecristi settlement, an area nationally and internationally known for its rich culture, and the place of the famous straw hats.

Maria lives here.  She is 41 years old, married, and has four children, ages 21, 18, 15, and 13.  All of her children still live with her.  The two youngest attend high school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Maria is asking for this loan so she can help her husband who sells fish.  He travels the entire city on his tricycle selling his products.  He buys his products from fishermen at the beaches in Manta at dawn and has been doing this for more than 12 years.  He works hard so that his family is not in need of anything.
 
The money from this loan will be used to buy fish to sell daily.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and enjoys it because of the help she receives from the loans.  They help her get ahead. Her dream is to buy a car so that her husband can make his rounds.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Holalla Dominga

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Holalla, tiene 58 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en la liga cantonal.

Doña Holalla es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de artesanía, ella elabora flores a base de telas, vestidos para muñecas,  también compra canastas de mimbre sin pintar y después  ella les adorna en diversos colores y diseños, lleva todos sus productos una vez por semana hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a entregar a distintos bazares y lugares donde le compran toda su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta la noche cuando tiene pedidos que llevar, lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años y que gracias a esto ella ayudo a sus hijos a salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar canastas, pinturas, telas, hilos, etc. para todos los productos que elabora. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para continuar en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the José Cesario Reyes communal bank meet every two weeks in the Montecristi settlement, an area nationally and internationally known for its rich culture, and the place of the famous straw hats.

Holanlla lives here.  She is 58 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three adult children who live on their own.  Her husband works for the local sports league

Holalla is a great housewife who decided to sell arts and crafts in order to obtain her own income.  She makes cloth flowers and different colored and designs of dresses for dolls.  She takes her products to the city of Guayaquil once a week to sell at the various bazaars and places where people buy merchandise.  She works from 8:00 am to nightfall, whenever she has requests to deliver.  She’s been doing this for more than 20 years and thanks to this she has been able to help her children get ahead. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy baskets, paints, fabrics, thread, etc., for all the items she makes.  She has been part of the communal bank from the beginning and likes it because the loans have been of great help in continuing her business. Her dream is to be in good health in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  de 44 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad, de 13, 10 años los cuales están estudiando. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con  sus hijos. Y prepararles comida típica como ‘nacatamales’ lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria. Ya que tuvo que trabajar desde muy temprana edad, para salir adelante en la vida, por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su espíritu y ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería  es una pequeña tienda que vende en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shapoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and the single mother with two children, ages 13 and 10.  Both attend school.  She is originally from Leon, an area located in the western part of the country.  She likes to spend quality time with her children in her spare time, and cook typical food for them, such as nacatamales.  Unfortunately, she was not able to attend university due to lack of financial resources.  She had to go to work at an early age in order to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, she set up a convenience store in her home.  It’s a store where she sells small quantities of merchandise such as coffee, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, milk, and bread.  She works 12 hours a day in her business and her goal is to invest in it so she can stock her store, buying and selling consumable products.  She wants to have a better income in the near future.  Mercedes is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who make it possible for people from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
Aura estela de 52 años de edad, soltera, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de momentos a sola, ordenar su casa, y descansar tranquila al aire libre. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar sus estudios, ya que se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.


Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica, la venta de granos básicos, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, trigo. Ella dedica unas 10 horas diarias a su negocio. El cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante, con uno canastos de unos 20 kg sobre su cabeza, diariamente. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de granos básicos  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Aura Estela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Aura is 52 years old, single, and originally from Leon, located in the western part of the country.  She likes to spend time alone in her spare time, organize her house, and relax outside.  Unfortunately she was not able to complete her studies due to a lack of financial resources and having seen the obligation to go to work to help with the household expenses.  Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, she sells basic grains such as beans, rice, sugar, and wheat.

She works for 10 hours a day in her business, which she does on foot, with a 20 kg basket on her head every day.  Her goal is to stock her business of buying and selling basic grains so that she can have a better income in the near future.  Aura Estela is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who make it possible for people from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos naturales y dietéticos,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra de variedad de productos para diversificar la gama de sus productos  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales y dietéticos por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Rosario is continuing with her business selling natural products and diet aids.  She says that things went well with her previous loan, because she used it to buy a variety of items to diversify the range of her products.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy natural products and diet aids at wholesale.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy diet aids and natural products

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”.

La socia es la Sra. Leslie tiene 33 años, conviviente y tiene 03 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de mazamorra, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar,canela entre otros para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, crianza de animales menores, venta de pollipapa, taller de mecánica, venta de celulares, venta de artesanías, venta de chompas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “SUMAC PURIRISUN” communal bank.

Leslie is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children.  She sells porridge and has had this business for some time.  Things are going well for her, thanks to the daily effort she puts in.  She sells on foot throughout the city center and she gets her family ahead in this manner.  She wants to continue working and supporting her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sugar, cinnamon, and other things for her business.

The other members have other businesses such as food sales, raising small animals, chicken and potato sales, auto repair, cellular phone sales, arts and crafts, and sweater sales.   [Leslie] is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Wendy Rossana

texts.es:
Wendy es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Wendy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con sus pequeños por las calurosas t acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wendy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, adicionalmente también brinda servicios de alimentación, vendiendo como, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Wendy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una refrigeradora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder conservar sus alimentos, insumos y bebidas, de esta manera Wendy podrá contar con alimentos frescos y adecuados para preparar sus deliciosos potajes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Wendy is a 29 year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her 2 small children, who she loves and who are her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, enthusiastic, and hardworking person who devotes all of her efforts to providing for her family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work from a very young age, Wendy was not able to study for a degree in business administration, but she would have liked to have done so.  In her free time, she enjoys strolling with her little ones through the warm and welcoming streets of her city.  

On her own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Wendy works in her small business selling groceries and drinks.  She also provides food services, selling as she works every day for about 10 hours.  She believes that the business is doing well because of her good prices and because of the friendly service she provides to her customers.

Wendy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, she will be able to buy a refrigerator where she can keep her food, supplies and drinks.  In this way, Wendy will be able to have food that is fresh and ready for her to prepare her delicious dishes so that she can continue to work and strive toward her greatest dream: to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Danny Charles

texts.es:
Danny es un hombre de 33 años,  es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Danny pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Danny trabaja como promotor de ventas en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Danny se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y la compra de repuestos que necesita su moto lineal, de esta manera Danny tendrá su moto en mejor estado y podrá seguir transportándose desde las lejanías de su hogar hacia su trabajo, así pues Danny seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de crecer como profesional y tener un mejor trabajo.
texts.en: Danny is a 33 year old, single man and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed.  Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Danny was able to study for a professional degree in Accounting.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer and he sometimes cooks a delicious “arroz con pollo” to share with his family.  By his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Danny works as a sales promoter for a business in his city.  He works every day for about ten hours and feels that it is going well because of his good performance and the kind treatment he provides to others.  Danny is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to the support they offer, he will be able to purchase parts for his motorcycle and do maintenance on it.  In this way, Danny’s motorcycle will be in better condition and he will be able to travel the long distance from his home to his job.  Thus, Danny will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of growing as a professional and having a better job.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his motorcycle and do maintenance on it.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Santiago sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de una motocicleta y esto le ayudo abastecerse mas rápido de mercadería,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes y galletas por mayor ya que incremento sus ventas y desea surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santiago still has the same business selling products of basic need at his neighborhood store. He says that things went well with the previous loan, as he used it to buy a motorcycle and this helped him to stock merchandise faster. 

At this time he asks for the loan to buy merchandise like groceries and cookies wholesale, as they increased his sales and he wants to stock his store. He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity you are giving him to grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store

loans.name: Katherine Yomayra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kennedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señorita Katherine, tiene 21 años  de edad, es soltera, estudia Trabajo Social en una universidad de Manta. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Kattherine es una joven luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios recursos para sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale a recorrer por la ciudad en sus ratos libres, también vende en la universidad donde estudia, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Esta es la forma como ella sale adelante con sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo para sus ventas. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su negocio.

Su sueño es terminara sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The Nueva Kennedy communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montegristi settlement, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and nationally and internationally knows arts.  It’s the place of the famous toquilla straw hats.

Katherine lives here.  She is 21 years old, single, and studies social work at a university in Manta.  She lives with her parents.

Katherine is young and hardworking and likes to take care of herself and earn her own money for her schooling.  She sells all types of clothing door to door and travels around the city in her spare time.  She also sells at the university where she studies.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  This is how she advances her studies.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing to resell.  She has been with the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because of the great support for her business.

Her dream is to complete her education and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kennedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María  junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado de Montecristi, ellos muy de mañana se van a comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y una vez que tienen los productos arman un pequeño puesto en el mercado a la espera de que lleguen los clientes a abastecerse de estos productos. Llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad y esto les ha servido para sacar a su familia delante de una manera honrada.
	
Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar legumbres, verduras y frutas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de estos créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Nueva Kennedy communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montegristi settlement, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and nationally and internationally knows arts.  It’s the place of the famous toquilla straw hats.

Maria lives here.  She is 45 years old, married, and has three adult children who still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Maria sells fruits and vegetables in the Montecristi market.  They go out very early in the morning to buy from the large suppliers and stock a small stall once they have their inventory.  They’ve been doing this for 10 days and they have been able to get their family ahead in an honest way.

They will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  She is a charter member of the communal bank and enjoys it because of the help she has gotten through the loans to get ahead.  Her goal is to open a food store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: La Sra. Adela tiene 38 años, casad  con dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 13 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Lima,   La Sra. Adela una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Adela les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de La Sra. Adela es poder mejorar su puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Adela is 38 years old and married with two children aged 8 and 13. She makes a living from selling food in her sales post in the Alto Lima area. Adela is a very hardworking person who is acquiring stability and solvency with dedication, little by little, and is also acquiring popularity. She is very well known among her clients, as Adela attends to them in a very friendly manner.

With the money from the loan, she will buy supplies to make her foods, like groceries and oil wholesale. The client knows that it will be possible to grow even more with a lot of effort and thus keep making a legacy for her family's well being and her own. Adela wants to be able to improve her position, as this will make her grow more in her business and thus improve her financial earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies like groceries and oil wholesale

loans.name: Las Alajas De Coxom Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Jacinta es de estado civil casada, de 39 años de edad, curso 3 años de educaion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio, inició este negocio con un capital pequeño y hasta la presente fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la barberia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar mercadería para ampliar su negocio como: calcetines, playeras, pants, gorras, ropa interior, etc. en el futuro desea que su negocio crezca y quiere contar con mas capital; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, artesanía y pecuerio.
texts.en: Margarita Jacinta is married, 39 years old and has a third-grade education. She has two children who are in school. She makes a living selling clothes after starting her business with a little capital seven years ago. She counts on the support of her husband, who makes a living as a barber. She organizes the group and is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise like socks, T-shirts, pants, caps, undergarments and other items to expand her business. In the future she wants her business to grow and earn more capital. The other members of the group make a living in commerce, handicrafts and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like socks, T-shirts, pants, caps, undergarments and other items.

loans.name: Las Samaritanas La Union Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Estela de estado civil casada, de 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 3 estudian; ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos tipicos, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva ya 13 lindos años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y tela para poder elaborar sus tejidos, en el futuro desea que su capital y su negocio prosperen para poder ayudar de mejor manera a su familia; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía, comercio y crianza de pollos.
texts.en: Aura Estela is married, 26 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She makes a living weaving traditional items. She started the business with a little capital 13 sweet years ago. She organizes the group and is requesting a loan to purchase thread and fabric to weave her items. In the future she wishes that her capital and business will prosper so she can better help her family. The other members of the group make a living in handicrafts, commerce and raising chickens.

loans.use: the purchase thread and fabric to weave.

loans.name: Princessa Group

texts.es: Margarita, es integrante del grupo Princessa, trabaja vendiendo productos naturales para el cuidado de la salud; inició hace 2 años con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El crédito le a ayudado a surtir mas productos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener su propio local y con las ganancias comprar una casa para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the communal bank "Princessa."  She works selling natural healthcare products.  She started her business 2 years ago so that she could help her husband with the household expenses.  This loan will help her to stock up with more products.  Margarita's goal is to grow her business and have her own store, so that with the earnings she could buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with natural healthcare products

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS CAPULLITOS”  está conformado por 9 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras   dedicadas a actividades diversas del comercio minorista. Juana tiene 49 años casada con 3 hijos. Dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza en sus tiempos libres vende  productos  nutritivos omnilife hace un año y medio. Su mayor deseo es darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y mejor sus ingresos económicos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Juana es la cuarta persona parada del lado derecho. María no se entra presente en la foto porque tenía clientes que atender.
texts.en:
The group "Los Capullitos" is made up of 9 hardworking and enterprising women.   They have a variety of retail trade businesses.  Juana, 49, is married and has 3 children.  She's had a business selling beauty products for a year and a half, and in her spare time she sells nutritional Omnilife products.  Juana's main desire is to enable her children to become professionals and to increase the family's income.  

This group thanks the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Juana is the 4th person standing from the right.  Maria is not seen in the photo because she had customers that she had to attend to.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife nutritional products

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es: Jade es un grupo solidario, ya tienen 5 ciclos con el crédito y son mujeres muy buenas y trabajadoras. Sintia a sus 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 niños, y es estilista; estudio cerca de 1 año y ahora quiere ver reflejado en su negocio los conocimientos que adquirió. El crédito la ayudara a crecer e invertir en productos como: tintes para cabello, cremas, enjuagues, maquillajes, aparatos, etc. Una gran meta para Sintia es poder darles un buen estudio a sus hijos, ademas de que a corto plazo quiere adecuar mejor la estética en su casa.
texts.en: The communal bank "Jade" has already completed 5 loan cycles. They are a group of very good and hardworking women.  Sintia, 30, is the mother of 3 children, and she is a hair stylist.  She studied this trade for about a year, and now the knowledge that she obtained is reflected in her business.  This loan will help her to grow and to invest in products such as: hair dyes, creams, rinses, makeup, equipment, etc.  Sintia's greatest goal is to provide her children with a good education.  In addition, over the short term, she wants to better equip the salon that she has in her house.

loans.use: to invest in hairdressing supplies such as dyes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupos “LOS ANGELES” conformado por 14 socios responsables en sus cuotas ellos se encuentran  pasando el ciclo 10 cada uno de ellos se dedica a diversas actividades del comercio. Ana tiene 42 años es soltera trabaja como ama de casa desde muy joven. En la actualidad iniciara su negocio de sandalias. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias. Su mayor deseo es que su nuevo proyecto de negocio le genere mayores ingresos.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Ana es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The "Los Angeles" group consists of 14 responsible members who are starting their 10th loan cycle. Each one of the members makes a living in various commercial activities. Ana is 42 years old, single and has been a housewife since she was very young. She currently is starting a sandals business and plans to use the loan to purchase sandals. Her biggest dream is for her new project to generate good income. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Ana is the first one on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase sandals.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes a la vez la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de lechon con tamal(plato hecho a base de carne de chancho),la socia lleva años en sus negocios los cuales les trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia desea poder seguir trabando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in the grocery store, and at the same time she continues to sell "lechon con tamal" (pork tamales). She has worked in her businesses for years, and they bring her satisfaction -- as much economic and personal. She wishes to be able to continue working because in this way she continues to support her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase sodas for her grocery store. She is happy for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase sodas for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
La socia Maria Ana tiene 71 años de edad,es soltera y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia tambien vende gaseosas,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maria Ana is 71 years old, single and has one son. She makes a living running a grocery store selling primary-need products like rice, sugar, milk and oil as well as soft drinks. She has had the business for eight years and it is going very well. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and oil. Maria Ana feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Edita Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Edita,  tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tienen tres hijos de  10, 4 años y  el menor de  6 meses  de edad, el  mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Doña Edita es una muy buena madre y esposa que con la finalidad de ayudar a su marido con la carga familiar se dedica a la venta de helados en su casa, ella también realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo,  él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), los mismos que entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para trasladarlos hasta las ciudades cercanas donde son utilizados. Ella por su parte desde su hogar se gana algo por su cuenta lo cual les sirve de mucho ya que los gastos son muchos sobretodo los estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar helados para la venta y  madera y  tierra para elaborar los ladrillos. Está casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Bankito Rio Bravo meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products such as toquilla straw hats known within and outside the country.

Edita lives here.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three children, ages 10 and 4 years and the youngest is six months old.  The oldest attends school.  Her husband is an artist.  Edita is a very good mother and wife who helps her husband with the family responsibilities.  She sells frozen treats from her home and is asking for this loan so that her husband can use it in his work.  He makes bricks (used for building houses), which he delivers to nearby merchants who go to his place to pick them up and take them to nearby cities where they are used.  She earns some money on her own, which helps them with very much with the household expenses, and above all with their children’s education.

She will use the money from this loan to buy frozen treats to sell, and lumber to make bricks.  She has been with the communal bank since near its beginning and she enjoys it because it helps her by giving her loans.

Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negorio de restaurant,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia a la vez continua preparando pasteles y tortas, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como aceite,harina,huevos,leche,verduras entre otros.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María continues dedicating herself to her restaurant. She has run the business for a number of years and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She continues to prepare cakes and pies and in this way she makes headway for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients like oil, flour, eggs, milk, vegetables and other items. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like oil, flour, eggs, milk, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio ,la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 08:00am hasta las 05:00pm,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues to work in the grocery store. She has worked in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the efforts she puts in every day for the business. She works every day from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She wishes to be able to continue working because in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase sodas for her business. She is happy with the loan and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sodas for her business.

loans.name: María

texts.es: Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora. ella desea poder invertir en su finca para poder trabajarla, es por eso que ella necesita de un préstamo por ochocientos mil colones (800.000) para la compra de semillas y así poder sembrar. con esto podrá mantener a su familia y vivir de la agricultura.
texts.en: María is a very hardworking woman. She wishes to be able to invest in her farm in order to be able to work on it. It is for that reason that she needs the loan for 800,000 colones in order to purchase seeds and in that way be able to sow.
