With this she will be able to support her family and live from agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to sow.

loans.name: Julia Sonia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Julia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mejoramiento de su local de ventas, así también comprará algunas mesas para acondicionar su negocio, de esta manera Julia podrá contar con un ambiente más adecuado y seguro para atender a sus clientes, de esta manera Julia podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia is is a woman of 43. She lives in the city of Ica, in Parcona district, with her son whom she loves and who is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to helping her family get ahead in life. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the fact she needed to work from a young age, Julia was not able to study for a professional career in management, as she wanted to do.  

In her free time she enjoys watching television and sometimes cooks very delicious Arroz Chaufa  (Peruvian-style Chinese fried rice] to share with her family. Through her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Julie operates a small restaurant. 

She works every day for approximately ten hours and believes it is going well because of her tasty cooking and the friendly service she offers her customers. Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help offered she will be able to carry out repairs and improvements to restaurant. She will also buy some tables to equip her business.  

In this way Julie will be able to have a safer and more appropriate environment for serving her customers. This way Julia will be able to continue working and doing her best to achieve her great dream of having a fine restaurant.

loans.use: For the repair and improvement of her small restaurant.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de sandalias y zapatos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende toda su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de sandalias para niños.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The communal bank member continues working in the store selling sandals and shoes. She has worked in this business for years. It is going well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts in every day for the business. She has a location where she sells all of her merchandise for her customers who request it. She wishes to be able to continue working because in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase children's sandals. She is happy about the loan and commits to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase children's sandals.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Don Javier es un señor trabajador. el desea poder colocar su propio negocio de fabricación de Pizarras, este es un negocio nuevo con mucha proyección en la zona. necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar los materiales para aumentar la producción de pizarras. con esto pretende poder crecer en su proyecto y poder vender mas pizarras.
texts.en: Javier is a hardworking man. He wishes to be able to have his own business making chalkboards. This is a new business with much growth in the area. He needs a loan of 1 million colones in order to purchase materials to increase the production of chalkboards. With this he hopes to be able to grow his project and be able to sell more chalkboards.

loans.use: to be able to make chalkboards.

loans.name: Juana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una nieta que también ya es mayor de edad, es como su hija y es quien los acompaña. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Juana es una muy buena esposa que para sentirse útil y ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de vivienda) para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, vende los ladrillos a comerciantes y estos los venden en otras ciudades. Gracias a esto él y sus hijos salen adelante en un negocio que tienen desde hace muchos años atrás.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y tierra para elaborar los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos ella puede ayudara a su marido e hijos a salir adelante.
 
Su sueño 4s tener un camión para vender sus productos y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The Bankito Rio Bravo meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products such as toquilla straw hats known within and outside the country.

Juana lives here.  She is 54 years old, married, and has seven adult children who are on their own.  An adult granddaughter lives with her and she is like a daughter to her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Juana is a good wife who is asking for this loan so that she can feel useful and help her husband with the household expenses and so he can use the money for his work.  He makes bricks (used for building houses), and he does so with the help of his children.  He sells the bricks to merchants who sell them in other cities.  Thanks to this, he and his children come out ahead in the business they have had for many years.

This loan is so that they can buy lumber for making bricks.  She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because she can help her husband and children get ahead, thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to have a truck so they can sell their products and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Las Chicas De San Fernando Group

texts.es: Las Chicas de San Fernando son un grupo excelente y trabajador. Sus integrantes son mujeres trabajadoras y activas, además de que ya tienen 8 ciclos con su crédito. María Guadalupe es una mujer honesta de 54 años, tiene 3 hijos, 2 ya mayores de edad, de 27 y 30 años, y el menor tiene 16 años. María Guadalupe se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y desea mejorarla, el crédito lo usará  para surtirla y además agregará venta de perfumería y accesorios. Ella desea ampliar mas su negocio familiar para beneficio de sus hijos y nos cuenta que se siente muy orgullosa del grupo en el que está, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy responsables.
texts.en: The women of San Fernando are an excellent and hardworking group. Its members are hardworking and active women, in addition to the fact that they already have done 8 cycles of loans. María Guadalupe is an honest woman who is 54 years old. She has 3 children, 2 who are already grown up (ages 27 and 30), and the youngest is 16 years old. María Guadalupe works in sales. She has a grocery store and wishes to improve it. She will use the loan to further stock the grocery store and add sales of perfume and accessories. She wishes to expand her family business for the benefit of her children. She tells us that she feels very proud of the group that she belongs to, since they are all very responsible people.

loans.use: to further stock her grocery store and to purchase perfumes and accessories.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the grocery items that she needed in her variety store. The loan also helped in her child's education and in their household. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Katlyn dreams of having a grocery store and hopes for a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto con su hijo. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace 10 años.
Doña Reyna su negocio está ubicado en punto estratégico por lo que es muy frecuentado por los vecinos de la comunidad y demás personas que transitan por ahí.
Doña Reyna necesita el crédito para  la compra de más producto ser frijoles, azúcar, pan, café, arroz, huevos, mantequilla, queso, manteca, harina, etc. 
Doña Reyna espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho al contar con los productos necesarios para satisfacer a sus clientes que la visitan a diario, además espera que sus ventas aumenten y de igual manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Reyna espera que en el futuro su negocio se consolide como uno de los más grandes de la comunidad.



Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en:
Reyna is a hardworking, responsible person who lives with her son in a community in southern Honduras.  She has had a convenience store for ten years.

Reyna’s business is located in a strategic location which is frequented by the residents of the community and others who travel through there.

Reyna needs this loan to buy more products such as beans, sugar, bread, coffee, rice, eggs, butter, cheese, lard, flour, etc.

Reyna expects that this loan will be very helpful in getting the necessary products to satisfy her customer demand.  She also expects her sales to increase and be able to improve her family’s quality of life with her increased income.  Reyna expects that in the future her business will become one of the largest in the community,


Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Martha De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y  venta de mariscos y pescados desde hace 10 años.
Doña Martha sale a vender de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en las distintas localidades cercanas a la misma.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de babosa, camarones, pescado seco, curvina, pancha, wicho, etc. producto que necesita para cubrir la demanda que la hacen sus clientes a diario.
Doña Martha espera que con esta inversión pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, además que sus ventas aumenten y asi mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Martha espera que su negocio sea uno de los más grandes y  reconocido de la comunidad asi también espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en:
Martha is a very responsible and hardworking woman who lives with her two children in a southern Honduras community.  She has been buying and selling seafood for ten years.

Martha goes out on foot to sell in her own and the nearby communities.  She needs this loan in order to buy slugs, shrimp, dried fish, curvina, pancha, wicho, etc.  She needs these products to satisfy her daily customer demand.

Martha hopes that this investment will satisfy her customers’ needs and that her sales will increase and improve her family’s quality of life.

Martha hopes that her business becomes one of the largest and best known in the community.  She also hopes to continue supporting her children so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina is 41 years old, married and has three children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Melodina grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. Melodina is requesting a loan of 60,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Melodina joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
This is Ruel, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Maribless, his business partner, and they children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruel oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community; He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Ruel dreams of expanding his business and hopes to give his children a good quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers and customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Erlinda hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 63 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia de 52 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad. Es  originaria de Managua  lugar que está ubicado en la zona de central  del país. Ana se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gustar disfrutar de su familia, y nietos, participar en actividades recreativas con sus nietos y cocinar una sabrosa comida típica como el gallo pinto.

Gracia s su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una librería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella dedica al negocio unas 10 horas diaria ofreciendo todos los artículos escolares y de oficina como cuadernos, lápiz, reglas, pega, papel fomi, libretas, engrapadoras, cartulinas, grapas, clic, marcadores, borradores, papel lustrio, libros. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ana Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is 52 years old, married, and has three adult children.  She is originally from Managua, a place located in the central part of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman with a great desire to succeed.  She likes to enjoy her family and grandchildren in her spare time and participate in recreational activities with her grandchildren, as well as cook delicious typical food such as “gallo pinto.”

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, she has a bookstore in her home.  She works ten hours daily, offering all of her school products, such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, paste, paper, fomi, booklets, staplers, construction paper, staples, clips, markers, erasers, glossy paper, and books.  The goal for the loan is to use the money to stock the business so that she can have a greater income in the future,  Ana Lucia is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who provide people from poor countries, like Nicaragua, the means to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Doña Petronila es una persona muy responsable y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y su nieto. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 15 años.
Doña Petronila  es muy conocida y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad.  El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de más producto como ser: maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, manteca, pan, café, refrescos, queso, huevos, papeles higiénicos, galletas, churros, etc. para así surtir más su negocio. 
Doña Petronila espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten, al contar con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes y con esto ganar más ingresos para mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia
Doña Petronila espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un mini mercadito y con esto  seguir apoyando familia y que su nieto continúe sus estudios para que sea una persona de bien y con mayores oportunidades  en la vida.





Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo 2013
texts.en:
Petronila is a very responsible and honest person who lives in a southern Honduras community, along with her husband and grandson.  She sells groceries and has for 15 years.  Petronila is very well known and visited by the residents of the community.  She needs this loan so she can buy more products such as corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, lard, bread, coffee, soft drinks, cheese, eggs, bathroom tissue, cookies, churros, etc. to stock her store. 

Petronila expects her sales to increase once she has the necessary supplies to meet her customer demand.  With this she can increase her income and improve her quality of life a bit.

Petronila expects this business to grow and become a mini market that will allow her to continue supporting her family and allow her grandson to continue his studies so that he will become a person of means with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2013

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra.  Irma tiene 49 años, casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 15, 14 y 10 años, todos ellos en edad escolar La Sra.  Irma se dedica  a la   venta de ropa interior lencería, medias para varones, mujeres, niños y niñas, ella tiene un puesto fijo en la Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Irma va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa interior por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias, y si le sobra un saldo comprara material de construcción para levantar una muralla a su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra.  Irma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa interior, La Sra.  Irma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Irma is 49, married, and has three children ages 15,14 and 10, all school-aged. She sells lingerie and men's, women's and children's hosiery. She has a permanent stand at the La Ceja market in the city of El Alto, where she sells her products. This loan is her first with the institution. 

Irma is going to use this loan to buy underwear at wholesale, and this way provide a variety of clothing to her customers and increase her earnings. If there is a balance remaining, she will use it to buy construction materials to build a wall on her house. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving her business. Irma is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of underwear. Irma is a very hard-working person and is happy about the opportunity she has been offered.

loans.use: To buy underwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Javier Helemher

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 25 años,  vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Javier no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja todos los días como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en sus ciudad y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de clientes.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para que su pequeña hija pueda desarrollar sus labores académicas y a la vez cuenta con métodos de estudios, así pues Javier seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder tener su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Javier is 25 years old and lives in the city of Ica, within the Parcona district.  He lives with his parents and young daughter, whom she loves and is his reason for living.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to moving his family ahead.  Unfortunately, he had to go to work at a young age to help support his family, due to a lack of financial resources.  He was not able to study for a systems engineering career like he wanted.  He likes to play soccer with his friends in his spare time and at times likes to cook a delicious chicken with rice dish to share with his family.

With much effort and dedication he works daily as a taxi driver and provides transportation services in his city.  He works about 12 hours a day and believes that things are going well because he knows the areas where he can get many customers.

Javier is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to them he will be able to buy a computer, which will be very useful so that his young daughter can develop her academic work and study methods.  Javier will continue working to achieve his greatest dream of having a transportation company.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a married Iraqi client who is 57 years old. He has no children and lives with his wife, whom he works hard to provide for. Salem owns a blacksmith’s shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2000 and is gaining good experience throughout his career. Salem is becoming well-known in the surrounding area and is continuously gaining the respect of his neighborhood. 

Salem is asking for a loan of USD 1,000. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator. Salem is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура  женщина в возрасте 40 лет.  Она замужем и является матерью  троих детей.  Манзура по профессии преподаватель.  Она с самого детства мечтала стать учителем и стремилась к этому.  Ее мечта сбылась и она теперь  работает учительницей в сельской школе.  Манзура очень любит свою работу и своих учеников как своих детей.   Её муж  находится на заработках  в России  и каждый месяц  по возможности отправляет денежный средства  своей семье.   До того как уехать в РФ ее муж   занимался животноводством.  Теперь Манзура продолжает этот бизнес сама.  Ее заработной платы ее не хватает поэтому    она    старается развивать  этот бизнес .  Ее муж когда уезжал научил ее этому делу и она с легкостью справляется с этим делом.   Старший сын помогает матери в этом.    
  Дома у неё несколько голов скота, они живут в сельской местности и имеется участки, где можно пасти скота. Манзура обратилась в организацию Арванд за кредитом,чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.  На полученный кредит планирует купить одного бычка и надеется на помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Manzura is a woman of the age of 40. She is married and the mother of three children. Manzura is a teacher by profession. Since her childhood she dreamt of becoming a teacher and worked hard towards this. Her dream came true and currently she works as a teacher at a rural school. Manzura loves her work very much and she loves her pupils like her children. 

Her husband is in Russia as a migrant worker, and every month, when it is possible, he sends financial support to his family. Before her husband traveled to the Russian federation he worked with livestock breeding. Currently Manzura continues this business herself. Her paid salary is not sufficient and therefore she tries to develop the livestock business. When her husband left, he taught her this activity, and she easily handles the business. Her eldest son helps her with this. At home they have several heads of livestock. They live in a rural area and have a plot of land where the livestock can graze. 

Manzura turned to the organization Arvand for a loan, in order to increase the number of livestock. She plans to purchase one bull calf for the loan, and hopes for help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Kirinkai

texts.en: Kirinkai is a 51-year-old man. He is married and is blessed with three children, who he supports. He has been a mixed farmer in the Narok area for the past four years. His monthly income is KES 45,000, and with this loan of KES 50,000 from KADET he plans to buy farm supplies and prepare his garden for crop growing. He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His dream for the future is to have a stable business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare his garden for crop growing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 57 years old. She is married and has eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making. Lucia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Koinanke

texts.en:
Koinanke's farming business is doing well and he has successfully paid off his previous loan. He has continued to educate his children with the proceeds from the farm. 

His second loan of 45,000 KES is to buy farm inputs, for example fertilizer and seeds, for use on the larger piece of land acquired. He plans to diversify to animal rearing with the increased proceeds.

His hopes are to grow his farming business into a large commercial venture.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, for example fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan tiene 56 años de edad es soltero y tiene 2 hijos,el socio se dedica al negocio de transporte,el tiene un moto que hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio se dedica a este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse una moto nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para la moto.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old, single, and has two children. He is in the transportation business. Juan has a motorcycle that he uses to provide taxi services. He works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Juan has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. His dream is to buy a new motorcycle.

Juan is requesting a loan so that he can buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 58 years old and married with five children. Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lucila has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and seasoning.

In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Barou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Barou est âgé de 25 ans et est père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, Barou s’intéressa vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, après quelques années d’activités de berger auprès de son père au village. 
Il opta pour l’achat vente des articles de boutique apprise  auprès de son oncle.  
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Barou décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Il compte acheter son son prêt,  5 sacs du sucre,  6 cartons de thé, 8 cartons de cigarettes, 8 cartons de savons, 2 cartons de sachets de lait en poudre et 1 carton de bonbon pour sa boutique. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et parfois à Bougouni; auprès des grossistes et effectue ses vente en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Barou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Barou is 25 years old and the father of one child.  He lives with his wife and child in a large traditional family in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.  Since he didn't go to school, he quickly got involved in income-generating activities, after spending a few years working as a shepherd alongside his father, in his village.

He then decided to buy and sell grocery products, a business he learned from his uncle.

Looking for additional financial resources, Barou decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is his first loan, which he will use to buy five bags of sugar, six boxes of tea, eight boxes of cigarettes, eight boxes of soap, two boxes of powdered milk sachets and one box of candy.  He will resell all these goods in his shop.

Barou stocks up in Bamako (capital city of the republic of Mali) and sometimes in Bougouni.  He buys his supplies from wholesalers and resells for cash and on credit to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Barou is expecting to make a monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay his loan and to contribute to his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalinda dreams that for her business to expand even more. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Sajida Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and seven children. Her husband is also doing a job in a hospital and running his own mobile phone shop as well. This shows that he is really a hard-working person. He is the only person earning in the family.

Sajida, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase some new mobile phones for his shop. He would purchase mobiles of high demand like Apple, Samsung, Nokia, etc., and then sell them at a profitable amount. Sajida is very hopeful for this loan.

NOTE: In the picture, Sajida is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Abdul Hussain

texts.en:
Abdul Hussain is a married youth client from Iraq, who is 30 years old. He lives along with his brother and his parents. Abdul Hussain and his brother provide the family income together.

Abdul Hussain owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2009 and gained his experience through taking some hair-cutting courses at an institute. Abdul Hussain is rapidly gaining fame and respect in his neighborhood thanks to the new methods that he uses in cutting hair.

Abdul Hussain is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take better care of both his family and his parents.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a display window.

loans.name: Ameliza

texts.en:
Ameliza is 29 years old and married with one kid.

Ameliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits and other groceries.

Ameliza has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fishing.

Ameliza aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits and other groceries.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells ready-to-wear merchandise.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gliceria dreams to expand her business by the grace of God and hopes to buy a vehicle. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evgenya

texts.en:
Evgenya is from Ijevan town. She works at local shop as a seller and lives with her husband and daughter. Her daughter Diana studies at Yerevan State University of Ijevan branch.

Evgenya and her husband work hard to sustain their family, but unfortunately the income they gather is barely enough for covering basic costs. It is very difficult for them to save money for their daughter’s education.

So Evgenya has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for Diana to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru: Калима – лидер группы «Кулкайыр», ей 50 лет. Калима работает контролером в местном офисе Электросетей и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав с суммы (KGS) 5,000 сом в 1992 году. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2,7 га земли с посевом зерновых культур, 2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом и 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Калима планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и мечтает купить семейный автомобиль.
texts.en:
Kalima is the leader of the group "Kulkajyr". She is 50 years old. Kalima works as a controller at the local electricity office. As an additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business in 1992 with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, she currently has 2.7 hectares of land with planted crops, 2 heads of cattle with offspring and 2 horses on her farm. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kalima turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). The aim is to purchase cattle for fattening. Kalima plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, and dreams of buying a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 36 years old, a hard-working and diligent woman. She has six children and her husband is working in a garment factory.

Abida has done various beautician courses and she is an excellent beautician by profession. She has been running her own beauty salon for 12 years. She is very skilled and independent woman, and she is helping her husband by running her own business. She spends all of her income generated from the business on the education of children so that they can have a bright future.

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would expand her business by adding some more space to her salon. Her clients are increasing day by day and current space is too congested so she would build one more room. She would also purchase some cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial scrubs, etc., and also some new hair stylers. This loan could help her to fulfil her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David's farming business is doing well and he has successfully paid his previous loan. He has since acquired a bigger piece of land on which he plans to grow a variety of crops. The proceeds will go a long way in the educating his children.

He has requested a second loan of KES.30,000 which will enable him acquire the additional farm inputs required for the larger farm. He has also diversified to animal rearing, which has added to his income.

His dream is to raise a well-educated family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil. Se dedico a este negocio hace dos años lo empezó con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos familiares. La clienta realiza su trabajo de venta de papeleria sola, comienzando ala 8h00 de la mañana hasta las 18h00 de la tarde.

La dificultad de trabajo que tiene ella es que tiene un hijo con discapacidad (problema de aprendizaje) ya que por eso tiene que dedicarle bastante tiempo a su hijo.

La clienta esta separa el esposo, tiene dos hijos uno estudia en una escuela fiscal y a su otro hijo lo tiene en una institución privada para niños especiales donde su hijo tiene una beca.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar pepelerias, cuadernos, pluams etc. El sueño de la clienta es llegar  a poder tener  un bazar en su casa, para poder estar con su hijo más tiempo y poder ayudarlo con su enfermedad.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She started her business two years ago in order to help with the family expenses. Her work involves selling stationery. She begins her work at 8:00 A.M. and continues to 6:00 P.M.

The difficulty with her work is having enough time to spend with her child who has a learning disability. She is separated from her spouse and has two children, one who is attending a state school and another who is on scholarship at a private institution for special-needs children.

With this loan, the borrower will buy stationery, notebooks, pens, and other products. Her dream is to have a bazaar in her home so that she can spend more time with her child and help him with his condition.

loans.use: to buy stationery, notebooks, pens, and other products.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente Luz sufrió la pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, Luz no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia. 

Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Luz trabaja brindando servicios de mantenimiento en un campamento de extranjeros en su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. 

Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de tramitación y formalización del terreno que su esposo le dejo como herencia para la construcción de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32-year-old woman that lives with her two small children in the city of Cañete, Mala district. She loves them and they are her main motivation in life. Unfortunately, Luz’s beloved husband passed away, and since then Luz struggles to get ahead with her family. Luz could not study at the university because she had to work from an early age to support her parents. During her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes she cooks a delicious “rice with chicken” to share with her family.

Luz works every day, with effort and dedication, giving maintenance to a camp for foreigners located in her town. She works approximately 12 hours every day. Luz enjoys what she does and believes that her good performance and her kindness to others are the reasons she does well.

Luz is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to pay for the documents needed to formalize her property rights over a piece of land her husband left her to build a house. She will continue working and struggling to make her biggest dream come true: to see her children become successful professionals and persons of good character.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork needed to formalize her property rights.

loans.name: Lisbeth Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra.  Lisbeth tiene 25 años, casada con dos hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 4 años, La Sra.  Lisbeth  se dedica  a la venta de joyas de plata, ella vende de manera ambulante visitando calles, barrios y también mercados  más populares de la ciudad del  Alto este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Lisbeth va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  variedad de joyas por mayor  y así ofrecer variedad de joyas a sus clientes  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra.  Lisbeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Lisbeth, 25, is married and has two children, ages 8 and 14.  She sells silver jewelry and works as a vendor in the streets, neighborhoods and most popular markets of the city of el Alto.  

This loan is Lisbeth's first through the institution.  She will use it to buy a variety of jewelry wholesale so she has more to offer her customers, providing them with better service and increasing her earnings.  Her main reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business.  Lisbeth is a hard worker and happy about this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wholesale jewelry.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de cereales como trigo,cebada entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un pequeño puesto donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de maiz y trigo para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues in the cereals business, selling wheat, barley, etc.  She has been in business for several years and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.  She has a small stall where she sells the merchandise her customers order.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and wheat for her business.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn and wheat for her business.

loans.name: Doncellas Group

texts.es: Julia es una joven mujer, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, vive en unión libre y se dedica al comercio; tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, comenzó hace 2 años aproximadamente, acondicionando la parte de la sala  y un cuarto para poner su negocio y menciona que con este crédito desea resurtirlo con frituras, golosinas, refrescos y demás artículos. Julia desea construir un cuarto en lo que es ahora la cochera de su casa, para así, poder captar mas clientes estando mas a la vista. Ella es integrante del grupo solidario llamado Doncellas, todas son mujeres que luchan por mantener el bienestar de sus familias y sacar adelante la economía de sus hogares.
texts.en: Julia is a young woman. She has two children, who are nine and two years of age. She lives in a common law marriage and makes a living from running a store; she has a small grocery store. She began approximately two years ago, turning part of the living room into a room for her business. She says that with this loan she wants to restock her business with fried food, candy, soda, and other items. Julia wants to build a room in what is now the garage in order to attract more clients, as the garage is more visible. She is a member of the solidarity group called Doncellas. They are all women who fight for the well-being of their families and to get ahead financially.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store with fried food, candy, soda, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de aceite,arroz,verduras,carnes entre otros.
La socia esta feliz con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cirila continues in the restaurant business, which she has been in for several years now.  Business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, working from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She wants to continue working to support her family.

Cirila is requesting a loan to buy oil, rice, vegetables, meat and other items.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, vegetables, meat and other items.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y su hijo de 16 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Cau Cau para compartir con su familia. Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 10 años Jorge trabaja como chofer brindando servicios de colectivo en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Jorge puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, pintado, entre otros; de esta manera Jorge tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones, así podrá seguir brindando sus servicios, con el deseo de poder lograr su gran de tener su propia empresa de transporte y así brindarle una profesión a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 44-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his wife and his 16-year-old son, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort into helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to work from a very young age, Jorge could not study Civil Engineering as he wished to. In his free time he likes to watch educational programs on TV and he occasionally makes a delicious Cau Cau [tripe stew] to share with his family. 

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Jorge has worked as a driver for ten years, offering taxi services in his city. He works every day from the early hours of the morning and he goes around the streets of the city in search of passengers. Jorge can work for approximately ten hours and he believes it is going well because of the kindness he shows to others. 

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do general maintenance on his car and buy paint and new tires for it, among other things. Jorge’s car will be in better condition and he will be able to continue offering his services. He wants to be able to achieve his great dream of having his own transportation business and thereby having a profession to pass on to his son.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car, and buy tires and paint, among other things

loans.name: Wilbert Isaias

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicandose a brindar el servicio de movilidad,el socio cuenta con una combi donde hace servicio de movilidad,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su combi.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Wilbert Isaias is still working in transportation, using his minivan to provide service.  He has been in business for several years now and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into it every day.  He wants to continue working to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance for his vehicle.  He is happy about the loan and grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Elsa Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elsa tiene 47 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de panes, la socia elabora panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (“The Lionesses of San Jerónimo”). The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member, Elsa, is 47 years old and married with four children. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of making bread. The member makes bread to sell to customers who ask for it. The member has spent some time in this business, which brings her economic and personal satisfaction. The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies, such as flour and butter, among other things, for her business.

The member feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the set repayments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as flour and butter, among other things, for her business

loans.name: Maritza Alejandrina

texts.es:
Maritza es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una joven con un carisma contagiante, asimismo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, ya que trabaja desde muy temprano en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad como obrera. Con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo le pone muchas ganas en todo lo que hace.

Maritza agradeceré el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar una cocina a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de Kerosene y en algunas oportunidades su madre ha tenido algunos accidentes debido a ello; así Maritza podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguirá luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Maritza, 22, lives in the city of Ica, district of Parcona.  She is a young woman with a contagious charisma and is determined to get ahead.  Very early in the morning she begins her work as a hired hand on a farm in her city.  With the income she earns she helps her mother cover household expenses.  Things are going well for her, she believes, because she is responsible, and above all, makes every effort to do a good job.

Maritza is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to them she can buy a gas stove and can get rid of the kerosene stove they have.  Sometimes her mother has had accidents with the kerosene one, and Maritza wants to give her family a better quality of life.  She will continue struggling and working to achieve her goal: "To get a university degree and have her own business".

loans.use: To buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Martin tiene 55 años de edad es casado y tiene 04 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como maestro de obra para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio lleva años ejerciendo este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como taladros.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank “The Lionesses of San Jerónimo”. The bank is situated in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Martin, is 55 years old and married with four children. The member alternates his daily activities with working as a foreman on the different jobs where his services are requested. The member has been doing this job for years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day. The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to purchase tools for his work, such as drills.

The member feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the set repayments.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work, such as drills

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Valerio tiene 61 años de edad es casado y tiene 04 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa publica, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo a la vez el socio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores conjuntamente con su esposa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Valerio belongs to the 'Las Leonas de San Jerónimo' community bank which is located in San Jeronimo district, in Cusco province, Cusco department.

61-year-old Valerio is married and has four children.  He works for a public company.  He has been working in his job for a long time and is doing well thanks to the hard work that he puts in every day.  Valerio also raises animals together with his wife.  This is how he gets his family ahead in life. 

Valerio is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for his business.  He is grateful for the loan he is receiving and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for his business

loans.name: Sunico

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sunico tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sunico is a member of 'Las Leonas de San Jerónimo' community bank which is located in San Jerónimo district, in Cusco province and department.

Sunico is 23 years old and lives with her partner.  Her business is raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She has been in her business for some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  Sunico raises her animals and then sells them to customers who ask her for them.  This is how she is making progress in life.

Sunico is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She feels grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es:
Sonia de 41 años de edad es madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la actividad de las confecciones hace alrededor de 30 años. El taller se encuentra ubicado en su casa. Se dedica principalmente a la confección de sudaderas, pijamas y camisetas. Los clientes potenciales son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. 
Sonia desea comprar insumos como telas, hilos, bandas y elásticos para la elaboración de sus prendas lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es tener una buena rentabilidad y convertirse en una fuente de empleo directa para la región.
texts.en:
41-year-old Sonia is the mother of two children.  She has been working as a seamstress for around 30 years.  Her workshop is located in her home.  Sonia  mainly makes sweatshirts, pajamas and t-shirts.  Her potential customers are family members, friends and neighbors.

Sonia would like to buy supplies such as fabric, threads, bands and elastic for making her garments.  This will allow her to improve her income and provide her family with a better quality of life.  Her biggest dream is to make good profits and become a source of direct employment in her region.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, bands and elastic

loans.name: Ilsy Damary

texts.es: Ilsy, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella realiza su propia actividad de negocio desde hace 4 años, donde vende productos cosméticos como cremas, lociones, champú, desodorantes y otros. Ademas realiza trabajos de confección de ropa y venta de ropa. El producto de cosmetico lo vende de manera ambulante y según pedido del cliente. Ha decidido por un préstamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar cosméticos como lociones, cremas,champú y ropa para surtir el negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Su deseo es crecer con el negocio para obtener más ganancias y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ilsy is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her children and husband in the small village of Arizona, Atlántida.  She has been running her own business for four years selling cosmetics such as creams, lotions, shampoo, deodorants and other products.  She also makes and sells clothing.  Ilsy sells her cosmetics door to door, according to her customers' orders.  She has decided to take out a loan for 6,000 lempiras to buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo, and clothing so that she can stock her business and keep her customers happy.  Her goal is to grow her business so that she can make more profits and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo, and clothing

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Don Andrés,  tiene 52 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El, toda su vida se ha  dedicado al comercio, tiene varios años de vender mercadería en general en su casa. Vende sandalias, cosméticos, talcos, presto barba, jabón de baño, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, champú, cremas, etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos al que le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar productos y surtir el negocio como ser: sandalias, cosméticos, productos de aseo e higiene. El préstamo le ayudara a incrementar las ventas  y los ingresos. Su meta es ampliar el mercado para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Andrés is 52 years old, single, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  He has been buying and selling stuff his whole life and has been selling general merchandise from his home for a number of years.  Andrés sells sandals, cosmetics, talcum powder, disposable razors, bath soap, toilet paper, sanitary towels, shampoo, creams, etc.  This business is his source of income and he puts all the time he needs to into it.

Andrés has decided to request a second loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy products and stock his business.  He will buy sandals, cosmetics, personal care products and personal hygiene products.  This loan will help him to increase his sales and his income.  His goal is to expand his market so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy sandals, cosmetics, personal care products and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Lorena Araceli

texts.es: Lorena, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijas y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace 4 años ella inicio su propio negocio de confección de ropa, compra y venta de ropa de cama, manteles de meza, cortinas, blusas y otros. La venta es realizada de manera ambulante y en el mercado. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la obtención de varios préstamos, en ODEF lleva siete ciclos con el actual el cual es por 6,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de ropa de cama, manteles de meza y cortinas para poder cumplirle a sus clientes. Su plan es mantener en crecimiento el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y dar bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is 45 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has two daughters and lives in a village in the area of Arizona, Atlántida. 

She started her own business 4 years ago. Her business involves making clothes, buying and selling bedclothes, tablecloths, curtains, blouses, etc.  The sales are made on a mobile basis and at the market. 

She has kept the business going by obtaining several loans. This is her seventh cycle with ODEF. The loan is for 6,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of bedclothes, tablecloths and curtains in order to meet her customers’ demands. Her plan is to continue to grow the business in order to obtain better earnings and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase bedclothes, tablecloths and curtains in order to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: David Edison

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, David no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cantar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, David trabaja como vendedor en una empresa de electrodomésticos de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cercar la parte trasera de su casa con materiales resistentes y seguros, de esta manera David seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
David is a single man of 28, who lives in the city of Ica.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all his energy to getting by.  Unfortunately, as money was tight and he had to work from a very young age, David was unable to study Business Administration as he would have liked.  

In his free time, he likes singing and occasionally cooks a delicious Seco de Pollo (chicken stew) to share with his family.  David is employed as a salesman in a household appliance shop, where he works on his own initiative and with tremendous effort and commitment.  He works for about 10 hours every day and believes that he is successful because of the way he performs his duties and the friendly way in which he treats others.  

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their help, he can improve his home by fencing in the back of his house with resistant and secure materials.  David will, therefore, continue to work and strive to realise his great ambition of being successful in his work.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Javier Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Javier no pudo estudiar la carrera militar que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar esteras, caña Guayaquil, madera y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para refaccionar el techado y otras partes de su vivienda, de esta manera él y su familia contaran con un ambiente mas adecuado y seguro, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 22-year-old man, is single, and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of the necessity he had to work from a very young age, Javier was not able to study for the military career that he wanted. In his free time he likes to listen to music and sometimes he cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken and rice dish] to share with his family.

Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Javier works as a security guard at a commercial business in his city. He works every day and can do so for approximately 12 hours. He feels pleased doing his job and he thinks it is going well because he is responsible and because he treats others in a friendly manner.

Javier is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to improve his home. He wants to buy mats woven from reeds, bamboo rods, wood and other things, which will serve to repair the roof and other parts of his home. In this way, he and his family will have a more appropriate and secure environment. He will thus keep working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia est une femme mariée de 36 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec son èpoux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices des revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente d’arachide. 
Nantie de  plusieurs années d’expériences, elle maitrise cette activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée. 
Après un prêt solidaire dans une association de femmes  de son quartier, qui fut correctement remboursé, elle décide de venir au prêt individuel et elle est à son premier prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 400 kg d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Bougouni  auprès des paysans producteurs. La vente se fait à la maison et au marché, en détail au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
Elle envisage réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Mrs Kadia is a married woman, 35 years old, and the mother of six children who lives with her husband and their children in the Hérémakono Centre neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. She did not attend school, and from an early age, became involved in income-generating activities. She followed her sister, and both are now involved in the purchase and sales of peanuts. She is now recognized and respected for this activity, which she has been doing for several years. Subsequent to a loan provided by an association of women in her neighborhood, which was successfully reimbursed, she is asking for her first individual loan in order to purchase 400 kg of peanuts. She stocks up in neighboring villages from local farmers, and sell the proucts from her home or at th market, individually or wholesale, and often for credit, to a customer base largely composed of consumers. She hopes this loan will allow her to achieve monthly profits of 30 000 FCFA (approximately 60 USD) that she will use to help her husband take care of the family expenses, to reimburse the loan, and to reinvest in her commercial activity.

loans.use: purchase peanut paste

loans.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
Rosa  es integrante de la alcancía Nueva Visión

Rosa  es casada tiene 02 hijos ambos son estudiantes,  uno de ellos está en la universidad. Rosa los apoya para que continúen estudiando  gracias a su trabajo puede costear algunos gastos que ellos requieren, hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería, durante todo este tiempo ha ganado muchos clientes  quienes le compran diversos productos como perfumería, maquillaje, bijouteria y lencería. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá abastecerse de mercadería y así poder ofrecer a su clientela variedad, quiere aprovechas que se avecina el día de la madre donde las ventas son muy buenas. Rosa esta agradecida por sus préstamos que le permiten ayudar a sus hijos, su mayor sueño en la vida es terminar la construcción de su casa y poner un negocio.
A los inversores de KIVA les quiere decir ¡Muchas gracias! Por apoyarla a ella y su grupo comunal.
Rosa es la segunda de la izquierda tiene blusa blanca.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank Nueva Visión [New Vision]. She is married and has two children; both are students and one goes to the university. Rosa supports their studies and thanks to her job, she can pay for some of the expenses they have. She has sold beauty products and lingerie for twelve years and has many customers, who buy all kinds of products from her: perfumes, makeup, imitation jewelry and lingerie.

With the loan she requested, she will be able to buy merchandise to offer more variety to her customers. She wants to take advantage of mother’s day, when sales are very good. Rosa is grateful for the loans she has received, because they help her support her children. Her biggest dream in life is to finish building her house and start a business.

She wants to say Thank you! to Kiva lenders, for supporting her and her communal bank. Rosa is sitting second, left to right, wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and lingerie.

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaila est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 1 enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant,  chez son père  à Bougouni, dans le
